summary:
UNLIKELY PLACES

 they are gathered one by one and then in droves: muggles, and soon squibs and muggleborns and anyone else...
caption:
UNLIKELY PLACES

they are gathered one by one and then in droves: muggles, and soon squibs and muggleborns and anyone else vulnerable to the ire of the death eaters. hidden away in safehouses across wizarding britain, protected by the order of the phoenix or by individual witches and wizards trying to do the right thing, they all stand on shaky ground, and nowhere is truly safe.

this and more on halys, a member-driven au marauders jcink premium site, set in 1981 at the height of the first wizarding war. we are now celebrating six months open - it’s the perfect time to join our community!

→ INDEX | GUIDEBOOK | CANON LIST | REQUESTS | SUBPLOT: SAFEHOUSE NETWORK

summary: USP oferece segunda edição do curso sobre Harry Potter
title: USP oferece segunda edição do curso sobre Harry Potter
description:
A Universidade de São Paulo (USP) abriu nesta terça-feira (26) as inscrições para o curso gratuito “Harry Potter: Caminhos Interpretativos”. As aulas sobre a obra literária de J.K. Rowling contam apenas com apenas duas exigências, o participante deverá ser maior de 18 anos e ter lido todos os sete livros da série Harry Potter.

As aulas serão ministradas por alunos de pós-graduação do Departamento de Teoria Literária da FFLCH (Faculdade de Filosofia, Letras e Ciências Humanas) e segundo Beatriz Masson, ministrante responsável, essa segunda edição do curso retomará algumas discussões já feitas em 2018, quando ocorreu a primeira versão.

CONTINUA DEPOIS DA PUBLICIDADE
(adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

Além de trazer novos tópicos, como a diferença entre os livros e as suas respectivas adaptações cinematográficas, será discutido também o impacto social de Harry Potter.

O curso terá uma carga horário de 20 horas divividas em oito aulas:
Aula 1 – “Os personagens-chave de Harry Potter”
Aula 2 – Harry Potter: herói romanesco”
Aula 3 – “Harry Potter: herói romanesco”
Aula 4 – “Harry Potter e a crítica literária”
Aula 5 – “Harry Potter: indivíduo em formação”
Aula 6 – “Harry Potter: indivíduo em formação”
Aula 7 – “O narrador de Harry Potter: entre livro e filme”
Aula 8 – “Os lugares de Harry Potter”

Harry Potter: Caminhos Interpretativos será ministrado entre 06 de abril e 01 de junho de 2019, aos sábados, das 9:30 ao meio-dia, no Prédio de Letras, sala 172 – Av. Prof. Luciano Gualberto, 403 – Butantã – SP. Ao todo foram disponibilizadas 60 vagas, que já foram preenchidas. Contudo, há uma lista de espera no site da FFLCH.

Leia também:
+ Campinas e São Paulo terão oficinas gratuitas sobre o papel da História na série Harry Potter

The post USP oferece segunda edição do curso sobre Harry Potter appeared first on Potterish.com.

blog.title: Ravenclaw Butterfly
blog.description:
Hello! My name is RB!
I belong in wise old Ravenclaw. Where if you've a ready mind, those of wit & learning, will always find their kind.
My self-appointed patronus is a butterfly which resembles change.
✌ RB OUT! ✌

summary: Ravenclaw House Relationships - Fanfiction Edition V.3
body:
Ravenclaw House Relationships - Fanfiction Edition V.3

RavenclawXRavenclaw: Likes mystery, loves overarching plotline, hates plot holes, and despises predictable endings

RavenclawXSlytherin: Likes whump, loves angst, hates unrealistic descriptions of wounds and injuries, and despises overuse of the word “said”.

RavenclawXGryffindor: Likes road trip fics, loves action scenes, hates excessive dialogue, and despises dragged out begginings

RavenclawXHufflepuff: Likes romance, loves fluff fics, hates simple miscommunications, and despises character bashing.

summary: Ron Weasley- I don’t know if this particular post has already been made but just in case it hasn’t
body:
Ron Weasley- I don’t know if this particular post has already been made but just in case it hasn’t


…but Harry headed straight back to the Gryffindor common room, where he found Rom and Hermione playing chess. Chess was the only thing Hermione ever lost at, something Harry and Ron thought was very good for her.


“Don’t talk to me for a moment,” said Ron when Harry sat down next to him, “I need to concen–” He caught sight of Harry’s face. “What’s the matter with you? You look terrible.”


So here we witness Ron playing chess with Hermione and concentrating hard because it’s not always he gets the chance to beat Hermione. But when he sees the look on Harry’s face, he doesn’t just pause his game but completely abandons it to know what’s up with him. And it’s the little things in friendships that count. So don’t tell me you still think Ron wasn’t the best friend Harry deserved.

summary: Extremely Tired James: *Grabs a blanket, wraps newborn Harry in it, sets it down, falls asleep* *The next morning* Lily: I can’t...
body:
Extremely Tired James: *Grabs a blanket, wraps newborn Harry in it, sets it down, falls asleep*

*The next morning*

Lily: I can’t find Harry or your stupid invisibility cloak anywhere.

James: I’ve made a terrible mistake.

blog.name: bitingdownpromo
blog.title: Biting Down
blog.description: The year is 2027. The wizarding community is tearing itself apart as danger lurks around every corner; the possibility of a wizarding epidemic sends the community into a frenzy that brings a new evil to power. Will you fight for what you believe, or take the path of least resistance?

summary:
the electronics of your heart...
 The year is 2028. After an incendiary article from Rita Skeeter reporting an increase in...
caption:
the electronics of your heart…

The year is 2028. After an incendiary article from Rita Skeeter reporting an increase in squib births, the wizarding world is tossed into chaos concerning the loss of magical heritage. The renegades vow to protect what’s left of magical blood without caring about the damage along the way. More and more wixen go missing, including the Weasleys’ own Dominique. The Ministry fights within itself as Percy Weasley and Hermione Granger battle for the position of Minister of Magic, tearing the fabric holding wizarding society together.

see how fast they fall apart…

Will you fight for what you believe, or take the path of least resistance? Whether you flee or bite down and take the heat, the next great war is coming and the outcome is up to you. Welcome to Biting Down.

home | plot | rules | wanted connections | character suggestions | application

Our roleplay currently has many canon characters available, such as Victoire Weasley, Louis Weasley, James Potter, Scorpius Malfoy, and both Scamander twins. We also welcome original characters, with lots of surnames available from canon!

blog.description: An automated feed for the Tom/Harry and Voldemort/Harry AO3 tags. Not a fic recs blog.

summary: Neither can Live (while the other survives)
title: Neither can Live (while the other survives)
description:
by Katology

(Rewrite of my first ever fanfic. If you like terribly written fics, read the original)

Amor Anima Revelare- “Soul Love Reveal” (google translate)

1/3 of all magicals have a soulmate. Tom Riddle, Lord Voldemort, thought he didn’t have one.

He did.

blog.name: greenhands5
blog.title: Vixen519
blog.description: You'll never know what you're capable of if you don't try - SMG

summary: 35 weeks now
body:
35 weeks now

Yea, I’m the final countdown. It’s currently 3:12AM my time and can’t sleep because A)had to use 🚽 & B)now heartburn. So till tired kicks back in (which god I hope is soon since I have work today), I’m updating what’s happening in my life other than my random reblogs.

Baby’s room is like 97% ready, just need to get crib/her first bed put together, frames for some Harry Potter artwork and all will be ready for her. Her closet I’m particularly proud of because of the organization- it looks right out of IKEA- also she already has her own laundry hamper. Yea I’ve been nesting hardcore guys. This week I’m packing my hospital bag, with snacks- so I won’t be caught off guard. Hubs and I are particularly antsy about this since we’ve had 6 couples/friends go into labor at this point in the past 3 months. To say he’s watching me like a hawk is an understatement.

I’m now having my weekly check ups, which my doctor started a week earlier than usual due to my Epilepsy but thankfully things in *that* area have been ok. Yesterday at the appointment she checked me for the first time to see how dilated I am: no one warned about THAT shit! Many noises of pain came out of me but I good not to swear infront of my doctor- I’m holding off till Delivery Day for that. The baby is doing great, most of the scans/checks she’s been camera shy like her Dad but she’s in the right position now. Her heartbeat is LOUD/strong- literally every time we hear it it sounds like a car motor, lol.

I’ve had one baby shower, which was amazing! My sister, Aunt and a close friend who’ve I’ve known for 15 years threw it for me. It was Harry Potter themed 💗, got several Harry Potter outfits for her, & a HUGE soft blanket my cousin got in Orlando too! Some of my husbands relatives hand made some burp cloths, blankets and they are sooo soft! They always make beautiful things, makes me kinda feel like a bad wife in that regard as I suck as sewing. One thing I’m going to do with all the cards/list of who gave what, is use one of the two scrapbooks so one day Kaylee can see it with all the lovely messages they wrote in there.

blog.name: accio-shitpost
blog.title: shitpost managed
blog.description:
FAQ

unforgivably cursing you with our existence since 1965

as seen in Bo Burnham's Eighth Grade, apparently

we have a Discord server! join here! (15+ only please)

we track the tag 'accioshitpost' (without a dash) so if you have art or a fic based on of one of our posts, pop it in there and we'll reblog it for you! we always appreciate your creativity!

you can find our amazon wishlists here and here - if you get us anything, we'll post a picture and a thank you note!!

if you want to follow our personal blogs, here's Roxie's, here's Persephone's, and here's Jamie's

nazis, terfs, pedos, and anybody happy to defend or stand by them can leave. we don't want you. avada kedavra, shithead.

now in blue raspberry flavours, hitting stores soon!

blog.name: dumbledore-and-grindelwald
blog.title: grindeldore army
blog.description:
Des, She/Her, Grindeldore-enthusiast.
Fan of morally ambiguous characters and of the founders. Lots of meta. Pro Cursed Child. Previously: @dumbledore-grindelwald

summary: 'I loved you too Dumbledore.' 'I know.'
title: 'I loved you too Dumbledore.' 'I know.'
body:
As one of Dumbledore’s biggest fans out there I ’ve thought of his character and of his relationships a lot… and as a Grindeldore shipper I love the idea of Grindelwald being the love of Dumbledore’s life and in a way, on a romantic and sexual level and in terms of partnership, he was. That said, from my point of view Dumbledore’s REAL love-story in the HP series is between him and Harry.

 We’ve seen different kinds of relationships when it comes to Dumbledore.

He loved Grindelwald as a partner in every sense of the word, but Grindelwald was unable to return that love in the same way and to allow it to be the light in his darkness and the sanity to his madness. And even if, as I’ve speculated, Grindelwald surrendered during the legendary duel and came to some realizations of his own, their timing was off.

He loved Aberforth, Ariana and Kendra (a familial kind of love) but Aberforth distanced himself after Ariana’s death and the already existing cracks in their relationship were enhanced while the two women of his life died early and he was left alone and broken.

He loved Minerva and Hagrid and he did see them as friendsi n his way, but while both of them knew aspects of who he was (Minerva more so than Hagrid), neither had experienced Dumbledore’s darkest parts. The ones that he was ashamed of and that defined his actions throughout his life.

And then there was Dumbledore’s love for Harry. The love that snuck up on him; the one that he had not intended to feel. The kind of love that a father feels for his son, which he tried to deny…

DUMBLEDORE: Harry, don’t you think I wanted to fight him on your behalf? I would have spared you if

I could —

HARRY: “Love blinds us”? Do you even know what that means? Do you even know how bad that advice

was? My son is — my son is fighting battles for us just as I had to for you. And I have proved as bad a father to him as you were to me. Leaving him in places he felt unloved — growing in him resentments he’ll take years to understand —

DUMBLEDORE: If you’re referring to Privet Drive, then —

HARRY: Years — years I spent there alone, without knowing what I was, or why I was there, without knowing that anybody cared!

DUMBLEDORE: I — did not wish to become attached to you —

HARRY: Protecting yourself, even then!

DUMBLEDORE: No. I was protecting you. I did not want to hurt you …

DUMBLEDORE attempts to reach out of the portrait — but he can’t. He begins to cry but tries to hide it. But I had to meet you in the end … eleven years old, and you were so brave. So good. You walked uncomplainingly along the path that had been laid at your feet. Of course I loved you … and I knew that it would happen all over again … that where I loved, I would cause irreparable damage. I am no fit person to love … I have never loved without causing harm.

Dumbledore did everything he could to ensure Harry’s survival but he also tried to timid his love because to his experience love tended to cloud his judgment and he ended up hurting and destroying the people he love. He tried to keep his distance and to be a mentor more than a parental figure; a failed fit because of Harry being starved for love, for being treated with respect by the adults who were responsible for him and of his appreciation of Dumbledore as a man worthy to look up to.

However, Dumbledore was wrong. This distance, this net of protection that he tried to keep in place was exactly what ended up hurting Harry and affecting him even as an adult:

HARRY: You would have hurt me less if you had told me this then.

DUMBLEDORE (openly weeping now): I was blind. That is what love does. I couldn’t see that you needed to hear that this closed-up, tricky, dangerous old man … loved you.

A pause. The two men are overcome with emotion.

HARRY: It isn’t true that I never complained.

DUMBLEDORE: Harry, there is never a perfect answer in this messy, emotional world. Perfection is beyond the reach of humankind, beyond the reach of magic. In every shining moment of happiness is that drop of poison: the knowledge that pain will come again. Be honest to those you love, show your pain. To suffer is as human as to breathe.

HARRY: You said that to me once before.

DUMBLEDORE: It is all I have to offer you tonight.

He begins to walk away.

HARRY: Don’t go!

DUMBLEDORE: Those that we love never truly leave us, Harry. There are things that death cannot touch. Paint … and memory … and love.

 Dumbledore’s last lesson is the thing that he did not manage to deal with his entire life: That pain, imperfection and one’s mistakes were something to be dealt with rather than to be hidden from the world. Things that could be understood and overcome through the forgiveness that comes with love.

And ironically, this last lesson was taught to him by Harry himself; by Harry who saw his darkness, who saw the way that Dumbledore  hurt him in and despite his bitterness and his trauma did not stop loving and trusting him. Harry who questioned him but never lost faith in him. Harry who carried him with him even when he was gone from the world.

HARRY: I loved you too, Dumbledore.

DUMBLEDORE: I know.

 This line has been criticized by many as Dumbledore being smug. This is not the case though. Dumbledore has already expressed his love for Harry in this scene. What we have here is Dumbledore getting closure, or rather the reader/audience getting closure in terms of Dumbledore’s story. Through the last fragment that represents Dumbledore in the living world we get the sense that, finally, Dumbledore knows that he is loved; flaws and all. Not just that he knows; but that he has been told so… that he lives on through Harry’s unconditional love.

 The immortality that this love provides him with is not by any means the character’s absolution, but it is definitely his catharsis.

DUMBLEDORE: I — did not wish to become attached to you —

HARRY: Protecting yourself, even then!

DUMBLEDORE: No. I was protecting you. I did not want to hurt you …

DUMBLEDORE attempts to reach out of the portrait — but he can’t. He begins to cry but tries to hide it. But I had to meet you in the end … eleven years old, and you were so brave. So good. You walked uncomplainingly along the path that had been laid at your feet. Of course I loved you … and I knew that it would happen all over again … that where I loved, I would cause irreparable damage. I am no fit person to love … I have never loved without causing harm.

Dumbledore did everything he could to ensure Harry’s survival but he also tried to timid his love because to his experience love tended to cloud his judgment and he ended up hurting and destroying the people he love. He tried to keep his distance and to be a mentor more than a parental figure; a failed fit because of Harry being starved for love, for being treated with respect by the adults who were responsible for him and of his appreciation of Dumbledore as a man worthy to look up to.

However, Dumbledore was wrong. This distance, this net of protection that he tried to keep in place was exactly what ended up hurting Harry and affecting him even as an adult:

HARRY: You would have hurt me less if you had told me this then.

DUMBLEDORE (openly weeping now): I was blind. That is what love does. I couldn’t see that you needed to hear that this closed-up, tricky, dangerous old man … loved you.

A pause. The two men are overcome with emotion.

HARRY: It isn’t true that I never complained.

DUMBLEDORE: Harry, there is never a perfect answer in this messy, emotional world. Perfection is beyond the reach of humankind, beyond the reach of magic. In every shining moment of happiness is that drop of poison: the knowledge that pain will come again. Be honest to those you love, show your pain. To suffer is as human as to breathe.

HARRY: You said that to me once before.

DUMBLEDORE: It is all I have to offer you tonight.

He begins to walk away.

HARRY: Don’t go!

DUMBLEDORE: Those that we love never truly leave us, Harry. There are things that death cannot touch. Paint … and memory … and love.

 Dumbledore’s last lesson is the thing that he did not manage to deal with his entire life: That pain, imperfection and one’s mistakes were something to be dealt with rather than to be hidden from the world. Things that could be understood and overcome through the forgiveness that comes with love.

And ironically, this last lesson was taught to him by Harry himself; by Harry who saw his darkness, who saw the way that Dumbledore  hurt him in and despite his bitterness and his trauma did not stop loving and trusting him. Harry who questioned him but never lost faith in him. Harry who carried him with him even when he was gone from the world.

HARRY: I loved you too, Dumbledore.

DUMBLEDORE: I know.

 This line has been criticized by many as Dumbledore being smug. This is not the case though. Dumbledore has already expressed his love for Harry in this scene. What we have here is Dumbledore getting closure, or rather the reader/audience getting closure in terms of Dumbledore’s story. Through the last fragment that represents Dumbledore in the living world we get the sense that, finally, Dumbledore knows that he is loved; flaws and all. Not just that he knows; but that he has been told so… that he lives on through Harry’s unconditional love.

 The immortality that this love provides him with is not by any means the character’s absolution, but it is definitely his catharsis.
trail.content:
As one of Dumbledore’s biggest fans out there I ’ve thought of his character and of his relationships a lot… and as a Grindeldore shipper I love the idea of Grindelwald being the love of Dumbledore’s life and in a way, on a romantic and sexual level and in terms of partnership, he was. That said, from my point of view Dumbledore’s REAL love-story in the HP series is between him and Harry.

 We’ve seen different kinds of relationships when it comes to Dumbledore.

He loved Grindelwald as a partner in every sense of the word, but Grindelwald was unable to return that love in the same way and to allow it to be the light in his darkness and the sanity to his madness. And even if, as I’ve speculated, Grindelwald surrendered during the legendary duel and came to some realizations of his own, their timing was off.

He loved Aberforth, Ariana and Kendra (a familial kind of love) but Aberforth distanced himself after Ariana’s death and the already existing cracks in their relationship were enhanced while the two women of his life died early and he was left alone and broken.

He loved Minerva and Hagrid and he did see them as friendsi n his way, but while both of them knew aspects of who he was (Minerva more so than Hagrid), neither had experienced Dumbledore’s darkest parts. The ones that he was ashamed of and that defined his actions throughout his life.

And then there was Dumbledore’s love for Harry. The love that snuck up on him; the one that he had not intended to feel. The kind of love that a father feels for his son, which he tried to deny…

DUMBLEDORE: Harry, don’t you think I wanted to fight him on your behalf? I would have spared you if

I could —

HARRY: “Love blinds us”? Do you even know what that means? Do you even know how bad that advice

was? My son is — my son is fighting battles for us just as I had to for you. And I have proved as bad a father to him as you were to me. Leaving him in places he felt unloved — growing in him resentments he’ll take years to understand —

DUMBLEDORE: If you’re referring to Privet Drive, then —

HARRY: Years — years I spent there alone, without knowing what I was, or why I was there, without knowing that anybody cared!

DUMBLEDORE: I — did not wish to become attached to you —

HARRY: Protecting yourself, even then!

DUMBLEDORE: No. I was protecting you. I did not want to hurt you …

DUMBLEDORE attempts to reach out of the portrait — but he can’t. He begins to cry but tries to hide it. But I had to meet you in the end … eleven years old, and you were so brave. So good. You walked uncomplainingly along the path that had been laid at your feet. Of course I loved you … and I knew that it would happen all over again … that where I loved, I would cause irreparable damage. I am no fit person to love … I have never loved without causing harm.

Dumbledore did everything he could to ensure Harry’s survival but he also tried to timid his love because to his experience love tended to cloud his judgment and he ended up hurting and destroying the people he love. He tried to keep his distance and to be a mentor more than a parental figure; a failed fit because of Harry being starved for love, for being treated with respect by the adults who were responsible for him and of his appreciation of Dumbledore as a man worthy to look up to.

However, Dumbledore was wrong. This distance, this net of protection that he tried to keep in place was exactly what ended up hurting Harry and affecting him even as an adult:

HARRY: You would have hurt me less if you had told me this then.

DUMBLEDORE (openly weeping now): I was blind. That is what love does. I couldn’t see that you needed to hear that this closed-up, tricky, dangerous old man … loved you.

A pause. The two men are overcome with emotion.

HARRY: It isn’t true that I never complained.

DUMBLEDORE: Harry, there is never a perfect answer in this messy, emotional world. Perfection is beyond the reach of humankind, beyond the reach of magic. In every shining moment of happiness is that drop of poison: the knowledge that pain will come again. Be honest to those you love, show your pain. To suffer is as human as to breathe.

HARRY: You said that to me once before.

DUMBLEDORE: It is all I have to offer you tonight.

He begins to walk away.

HARRY: Don’t go!

DUMBLEDORE: Those that we love never truly leave us, Harry. There are things that death cannot touch. Paint … and memory … and love.

 Dumbledore’s last lesson is the thing that he did not manage to deal with his entire life: That pain, imperfection and one’s mistakes were something to be dealt with rather than to be hidden from the world. Things that could be understood and overcome through the forgiveness that comes with love.

And ironically, this last lesson was taught to him by Harry himself; by Harry who saw his darkness, who saw the way that Dumbledore  hurt him in and despite his bitterness and his trauma did not stop loving and trusting him. Harry who questioned him but never lost faith in him. Harry who carried him with him even when he was gone from the world.

HARRY: I loved you too, Dumbledore.

DUMBLEDORE: I know.

 This line has been criticized by many as Dumbledore being smug. This is not the case though. Dumbledore has already expressed his love for Harry in this scene. What we have here is Dumbledore getting closure, or rather the reader/audience getting closure in terms of Dumbledore’s story. Through the last fragment that represents Dumbledore in the living world we get the sense that, finally, Dumbledore knows that he is loved; flaws and all. Not just that he knows; but that he has been told so… that he lives on through Harry’s unconditional love.

 The immortality that this love provides him with is not by any means the character’s absolution, but it is definitely his catharsis.

blog.name: bitingdownpromo
blog.title: Biting Down
blog.description: The year is 2027. The wizarding community is tearing itself apart as danger lurks around every corner; the possibility of a wizarding epidemic sends the community into a frenzy that brings a new evil to power. Will you fight for what you believe, or take the path of least resistance?

summary:
the electronics of your heart...
 The year is 2028. After an incendiary article from Rita Skeeter reporting an increase in...
caption:
the electronics of your heart…

The year is 2028. After an incendiary article from Rita Skeeter reporting an increase in squib births, the wizarding world is tossed into chaos concerning the loss of magical heritage. The renegades vow to protect what’s left of magical blood without caring about the damage along the way. More and more wixen go missing, including the Weasleys’ own Dominique. The Ministry fights within itself as Percy Weasley and Hermione Granger battle for the position of Minister of Magic, tearing the fabric holding wizarding society together.

see how fast they fall apart…

Will you fight for what you believe, or take the path of least resistance? Whether you flee or bite down and take the heat, the next great war is coming and the outcome is up to you. Welcome to Biting Down.

home | plot | rules | wanted connections | character suggestions | application

Our roleplay currently has many canon characters available, such as Victoire Weasley, Louis Weasley, James Potter, Scorpius Malfoy, and both Scamander twins. We also welcome original characters, with lots of surnames available from canon!
